docs.title: What is deployKF?
docs.text:
Answer

deployKF is the best way to deploy KF (Kubeflow) and other MLOps tools on Kubernetes to create custom, open, and cohesive ML Platforms.

docs.title: Who created deployKF?
docs.text:
Answer

deployKF was originally created by Mathew Wicks (GitHub: @thesuperzapper). However, deployKF is now a community owned project, and welcomes contributions from anyone who wants to help.

docs.title: What is the difference between Kubeflow and deployKF?
docs.text:
Answer

deployKF and Kubeflow are two different projects, but they are related:

  • deployKF is a tool for deploying Kubeflow and other MLOps tools on Kubernetes.
  • Kubeflow is a project made up of many different tools, including Kubeflow Pipelines, Kubeflow Notebooks, Katib, and more.
  • deployKF is NOT a fork of Kubeflow, but it does allow you to deploy the Kubeflow MLOps components.

docs.title: What are the components of deployKF?
docs.text:
Answer

deployKF has two main components:

  1. deployKF CLI: a command line tool for generating GitOps-ready Kubernetes manifests
  2. deployKF Generator: a package of templated Kubernetes manifests for use with the deployKF CLI

docs.title: How is deployKF licensed?
docs.text:
Answer

deployKF is licensed under the Apache License 2.0. However, some of the tools that deployKF can help deploy are licensed differently. Please ensure you are aware of the licenses of the tools you are deploying.

docs.title: Community
docs.text: The deployKF community is a welcoming community of contributors and users. We welcome participation from anyone who shares our mission to make it easy to build open ML Platforms on Kubernetes.

docs.title: Slack
docs.text:
The deployKF community uses the Kubeflow Slack for informal discussions among users and contributors.

Join the Kubeflow Slack

Tip

After you join, connect with us on the #deploykf channel!

docs.title: Mailing Lists
docs.text: The deployKF community has two mailing lists which are hosted on Google Groups.

docs.title: Users Mailing List
docs.text:
The deploykf-users mailing list is for users of deployKF to ask questions and share ideas.

Join the deploykf-users Mailing List

docs.title: Dev Mailing List
docs.text:
The deploykf-dev mailing list is for contributors to deployKF to discuss development and design.

Join the deploykf-dev Mailing List

docs.title: Get Support
docs.text: While we aim to make deployKF as self-service as possible, sometimes things go wrong, or your use case is a little different to the norm. In these cases, you have a few options.

docs.title: Join the Community
docs.text:
If you have a question, or just want to chat, you can:

  1. Post a message on the Slack
  2. Start a thread on the Users Mailing List

docs.title: Raise an Issue
docs.text:
If you have found a bug, or have a feature request, you can raise an issue on the relevant GitHub repository:

Component Repository deployKF Generator deployKF/deployKF deployKF CLI deployKF/cli deployKF Website deployKF/website

docs.title: Get Commercial Support
docs.text:
If you are interested in US-based commercial support, please reach out to Mathew Wicks, the founder of deployKF, on LinkedIn or via Email at mathew@aranui.solutions.

Note

If you are a vendor who would like to offer commercial support for deployKF, or would like use deployKF in your product, let's work together! Please reach out to Mathew Wicks on LinkedIn or at mathew@aranui.solutions.

docs.title: Step 1. prepare requirements
docs.text:
Info

To use deployKF you will need a Kubernetes cluster with ArgoCD installed.

Here are some popular distributions of Kubernetes, listed by platform.

Platform Kubernetes Distribution Local Machine k3d Local Machine kind Local Machine minikube Amazon Web Services Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) Microsoft Azure Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Google Cloud Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) Alibaba Cloud Alibaba Cloud Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) IBM Cloud IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service (IKS)

docs.title: Remote Dependencies
docs.text:
• Kubernetes (version compatability matrix)
  • ArgoCD (deploying ArgoCD)
  • (Optional) an external MySQL database (connecting your database)
  • (Optional) an external S3-compatible object store (connecting your object store)

docs.title: Local Dependencies
docs.text: • Gomplate (installing gomplate)

docs.text: TBA

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
The deployKF project is committed to protecting the privacy of our users. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit the deployKF website (the "Website"). Please read this Privacy Policy carefully. If you do not agree with the terms of this Privacy Policy, please do not use our Website.

We reserve the right to make changes to this Privacy Policy at any time and for any reason. We will alert you about any changes by updating the "Last Updated" date of this Privacy Policy. You are encouraged to periodically review this Privacy Policy to stay informed of updates. You will be deemed to have been made aware of, will be subject to, and will be deemed to have accepted the changes in any revised Privacy Policy by your continued use of the Website after the date such revised Privacy Policy is posted.

docs.title: Collection of Your Information
docs.text:
We may collect information about you in a variety of ways.

The information we may collect on the Website includes:

docs.title: Anonymous Usage Data
docs.text: When you visit the Website, we may automatically collect anonymous usage data to help improve the Website and understand how our users interact with it. This information may include, but is not limited to, your IP address, browser type, device type, pages visited, and time spent on the Website.

docs.title: Cookies
docs.text: We may use cookies and similar tracking technologies on the Website to, among other things, analyze trends, administer the website, track user's movements around the website, and gather demographic information about our user base as a whole. You can control the use of cookies at the individual browser level, but if you choose to disable cookies, it may limit your use of certain features or functions on our website.

docs.title: Use of Your Information
docs.text:
We may use the information collected from the Website for various purposes, including:

  • To monitor and analyze usage trends and preferences, and to improve the Website
  • To identify areas of the Website that may need improvement, optimization, or additional features
  • To diagnose and fix issues with the Website

docs.title: Disclosure of Your Information
docs.text:
We will not sell, trade, rent, or otherwise share your information for marketing purposes.

We may, however, share your information in the following situations:

docs.title: Third-Party Service Providers
docs.text: We may share your information with third-party service providers that perform services on our behalf, such as analytics providers. These service providers are required to protect your information in a manner consistent with this Privacy Policy and may not use your information for any purpose other than to carry out the services they are performing for us.

docs.title: Security of Your Information
docs.text: We are committed to protecting the information we collect and maintain. While no method of data transmission or storage is 100% secure, we implement administrative, technical, and physical security measures, such as encryption and access controls, to protect against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction of your information.

docs.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
docs.text: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.

docs.title: Contact Us
docs.text:
If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

privacy@deploykf.org

Last Updated: 2023-04-03

docs.title: deployKF Values (Configs)
docs.text:
The following is a summary of the values (configs) available in deployKF.

Tip

The full list of values and their defaults can be found in the default_values.yaml file in the source code.

docs.title: Argo CD
docs.text: Values for configuring ArgoCD.

docs.title: argocd
docs.text: Value Default argocd.namespace "argocd" argocd.project "default" argocd.source.repo.url "" argocd.source.repo.revision "" argocd.source.repo.path "" argocd.destination.server "https://kubernetes.default.svc"

docs.title: deployKF Dependencies
docs.text: Values for configuring the dependencies of deployKF.

docs.title: deploykf_dependencies.istio
docs.text: Value Default deploykf_dependencies.istio.enabled true deploykf_dependencies.istio.namespace "istio-system"

docs.title: deploykf_dependencies.cert_manager
docs.text: Value Default deploykf_dependencies.cert_manager.enabled true deploykf_dependencies.cert_manager.namespace "cert-manager" deploykf_dependencies.cert_manager.clusterIssuer.enabled true deploykf_dependencies.cert_manager.clusterIssuer.issuerName "deploykf-gateway-issuer" deploykf_dependencies.cert_manager.clusterIssuer.type "SELF_SIGNED" deploykf_dependencies.cert_manager.clusterIssuer.selfSigned.caIssuerName "selfsigned-ca-issuer" deploykf_dependencies.cert_manager.clusterIssuer.selfSigned.caSecretName "selfsigned-ca-issuer-root-cert" deploykf_dependencies.cert_manager.clusterIssuer.selfSigned.injectedConfigMapName "deploykf-gateway-issuer-root-ca-cert"

docs.title: deploykf_dependencies.kyverno
docs.text: Value Default deploykf_dependencies.kyverno.enabled true deploykf_dependencies.kyverno.namespace "kyverno"

docs.title: deployKF Core
docs.text: Values for configuring core deployKF components.

docs.title: deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway
docs.text: Value Default deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.enabled true deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.namespace "deploykf-istio-gateway" deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.gateway.name "deploykf-gateway" deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.gateway.selectorLabels.app "deploykf-gateway" deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.gateway.selectorLabels.istio "deploykf-gateway" deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.gateway.hostname "deploykf.example.com" deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.gateway.ports.http 8080 deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.gateway.ports.https 8443 deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.gateway.tls.enabled true deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.gateway.enableProxyProtocol false deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.gateway.xffNumTrustedHops 1 deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.service.name "deploykf-gateway" deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.serviceAccount.name "deploykf-gateway" deploykf_core.deploykf_istio_gateway.deployment.replicaCount 1

docs.title: deploykf_core.deploykf_dashboard
docs.text: Value Default deploykf_core.deploykf_dashboard.enabled true

docs.title: deploykf_core.deploykf_profiles_generator
docs.text: Value Default deploykf_core.deploykf_profiles_generator.enabled true

docs.title: deploykf_core.deploykf_auth
docs.text: Value Default deploykf_core.deploykf_auth.enabled true deploykf_core.deploykf_auth.namespace "deploykf-auth"

docs.title: deployKF Opt
docs.text: Values for configuring optional embedded applications that are used when external alternatives are not configured.

docs.title: deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql
docs.text: Value Default deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql.enabled true deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql.namespace "deploykf-mysql" deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql.rootUser.password "password" deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql.rootUser.existingSecret "" deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql.rootUser.existingSecretPasswordKey "password" deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql.kubeflowUser.username "kubeflow" deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql.kubeflowUser.password "password" deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql.kubeflowUser.existingSecret "" deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql.kubeflowUser.existingSecretUsernameKey "username" deploykf_opt.deploykf_mysql.kubeflowUser.existingSecretPasswordKey "password"

docs.title: deploykf_opt.deploykf_minio
docs.text: Value Default deploykf_opt.deploykf_minio.enabled true deploykf_opt.deploykf_minio.namespace "deploykf-minio" deploykf_opt.deploykf_minio.rootUser.username "minioadmin" deploykf_opt.deploykf_minio.rootUser.password "minioadmin" deploykf_opt.deploykf_minio.rootUser.existingSecret "" deploykf_opt.deploykf_minio.rootUser.existingSecretUsernameKey "username" deploykf_opt.deploykf_minio.rootUser.existingSecretPasswordKey "password"

docs.title: deployKF Tools
docs.text: Values for configuring MLOps tools from the deployKF ecosystem.

docs.title: Kubeflow Dependencies
docs.text: Values for configuring dependencies of Kubeflow tools.

docs.title: kubeflow_dependencies.kubeflow_argo_workflows
docs.text: Value Default kubeflow_dependencies.kubeflow_argo_workflows.enabled true kubeflow_dependencies.kubeflow_argo_workflows.namespace "kubeflow-argo-workflows"

docs.title: Kubeflow Tools
docs.text: Values for configuring MLOps tools from the Kubeflow ecosystem.

docs.title: kubeflow_tools.training_operator
docs.text: Value Default kubeflow_tools.training_operator.enabled true

docs.title: kubeflow_tools.volumes
docs.text: Value Default kubeflow_tools.volumes.enabled true

docs.title: kubeflow_tools.katib
docs.text: Value Default kubeflow_tools.katib.enabled true kubeflow_tools.katib.mysql.host "mysql.example.com" kubeflow_tools.katib.mysql.port 3306 kubeflow_tools.katib.mysql.auth.username "kubeflow" kubeflow_tools.katib.mysql.auth.password "password" kubeflow_tools.katib.mysql.auth.existingSecret "" kubeflow_tools.katib.mysql.auth.existingSecretUsernameKey "username" kubeflow_tools.katib.mysql.auth.existingSecretPasswordKey "password" kubeflow_tools.katib.mysqlDatabase "katib"

docs.title: kubeflow_tools.notebooks
docs.text: Value Default kubeflow_tools.notebooks.enabled true

docs.title: kubeflow_tools.tensorboards
docs.text: Value Default kubeflow_tools.tensorboards.enabled true

docs.title: kubeflow_tools.pipelines
docs.text: Value Default kubeflow_tools.pipelines.enabled true kubeflow_tools.pipelines.bucket.name "kubeflow-pipelines" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.bucket.region "" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.objectStore.host "s3.amazonaws.com" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.objectStore.port "" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.objectStore.useSSL true kubeflow_tools.pipelines.objectStore.auth.accessKey "minioadmin" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.objectStore.auth.secretKey "minioadmin" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.objectStore.auth.existingSecret "" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.objectStore.auth.existingSecretAccessKeyKey "AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.objectStore.auth.existingSecretSecretKeyKey "AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.mysql.host "mysql.example.com" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.mysql.port 3306 kubeflow_tools.pipelines.mysql.auth.username "kubeflow" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.mysql.auth.password "password" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.mysql.auth.existingSecret "" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.mysql.auth.existingSecretUsernameKey "username" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.mysql.auth.existingSecretPasswordKey "password" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.mysqlDatabases.cacheDatabase "kfp_cache" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.mysqlDatabases.metadataDatabase "kfp_metadata" kubeflow_tools.pipelines.mysqlDatabases.pipelinesDatabase "kfp_pipelines"

docs.title: kubeflow_tools.poddefaults_webhook
docs.text: Value Default kubeflow_tools.poddefaults_webhook.enabled true

docs.title: Version Matrix
docs.text:
The following tables are a summary of which dependency versions are supported by each version of deployKF.

Tip

The version wrapped with () is the default version included with deployKF.

docs.title: deployKF Dependencies
docs.text:
Dependencies of deployKF.

deployKF 0.1 Kubernetes 1.22, 1.23, 1.24, 1.25 Argo CD 2.3+ Istio (1.14), 1.15, 1.16 cert-manager (1.11) Kyverno (1.9)

docs.title: deployKF Core
docs.text:
Applications that are used in core components like deploykf-auth and deploykf-dashboard.

deployKF 0.1 Dexdeploykf-auth (2.35) OAuth2 Proxydeploykf-auth (7.4) KF: Central Dashboarddeploykf-dashboard (1.6) KF: Access Management APIdeploykf-dashboard (1.6) KF: Profile Controllerdeploykf-dashboard (1.6)

docs.text:
Optional embedded applications that are used when external alternatives are not configured.
